element.name: Werebat
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: A werebat is a humanoid afflicted with a rare form of lycanthropy that enables it to transform into a giant bator a bat-humanoid hybrid. (See the Monster Manual formore information on lycanthropy.) Most werebats are of goblin stock.

Deep Dwellers. Werebats are shunned even by goblin society because of their need to feed on blood to survive. They prefer to lair in dark places, such as attics and caves, and typically adopt nocturnal hunting habits.

element.name: Blood Drinkers
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: A werebat must consume at least 1 pint of fresh blood each night, or it weakens and gains one level of exhaustion that no amount of rest alone can remove. Each pint of blood the werebat consumes removes one level of exhaustion gained in this fashion.

sheet.description: A werebat must consume at least 1 pint of fresh blood each night, or it weakens and gains one level of exhaustion that no amount of rest alone can remove. Each pint of blood the werebat consumes removes one level of exhaustion gained in this fashion.

element.name: Werebat Resistance
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non magical weapons that aren't silvered in Raven or Hybrid Form.

sheet.description: You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non magical weapons that aren't silvered.

element.name: Werebat Dexterity
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: A player character who becomes a werebat gains a Dexterity of 17 if their score isn't already higher.

element.name: Werebat Speed
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: Speed 30 ft. (climb 30 ft., fly 60 ft. in bat or hybrid form)

sheet.description: While in your bat or hybrid form you have 30 ft. walking speed, 30 ft. climbing speed and 60 ft. flying speed.

element.name: Shapechanger
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: The werebat can use its action to polymorph into a Medium bat-humanoid hybrid, or into a Large giant bat, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

sheet.description: You can polymorph into a Medium hybrid form, a Large bat form, or back to your humanoid form. Any equipment you're wearing or carrying isn't transformed. You revert to your humanoid form when you die.

element.name: Echolocation (Bat or Hybrid Form Only)
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: The werebat has blindsight out to a range of 60 feet as long as it's not deafened.

sheet.description: You gain blindsight out to a range of 60 feet as long as you're not deafened.

element.name: Keen Hearing
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: The werebat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

element.name: Nimble Escape (Humanoid Form Only)
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: The werebat can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

sheet.description: You can take the Disengage or Hide action on each of your turns.

element.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: While in sunlight, the werebat has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. You also have darkvision with a range of 60 ft.

sheet.description: While in sunlight, the werebat has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

element.name: Multiattack
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only). In humanoid form, the werebat makes two scimitar attacks or two shortbow attacks. In hybrid form, it can make one bite attack and one scimitar attack.

sheet.description: In humanoid form, the werebat makes two light weapon attacks. In hybrid form, it can make one bite attack and one weapon attack. The werebat makes two weapon attacks, one of which can be with its light weapon.

element.name: Natural Weapons
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: Attack and damage rolls for the werebat's bite are based on whichever is higher of the character's Strength and Dexterity. The bite of a werebat deals 1d6 piercing damage in hybrid or bat form (the character's ability modifier applies to this damage), and the werebat gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt. This attack carries the curse of werebat lycanthropy.

sheet.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +{{werebat:bite}} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1d6 + {{werebat:bite:ability}} piercing damage, and you gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werebat lycanthropy.
